DataElement.preferredName: Cathepsin B Protein Relative Expression Level Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to describe relative protein expression level of Cathepsin B, an enzymatic protein that cleaves polypeptide chains like the one found in LUM015, as determined by western blot analysis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Cathepsin B Protein Expression Relative Value Level
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Cathepsin B (339 aa, ~38 kDa) is encoded by the human CTSB gene. This protein plays a role in proteolysis, immunity and the regulation of apoptosis._The biosynthesis of new (often sets of distinct, functionally related) protein products, usually involving new mRNA transcripts, typically in response to an activating stimulus._Considered in comparison with something else; dependent on or interconnected with something else; not absolute._A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.  (NCI)

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cathepsin B (339 aa, ~38 kDa) is encoded by the human CTSB gene. This protein plays a role in proteolysis, immunity and the regulation of apoptosis.

Concepts.definition: Cathepsin B (339 aa, ~38 kDa) is encoded by the human CTSB gene. This protein plays a role in proteolysis, immunity and the regulation of apoptosis.

Concepts.definition: The biosynthesis of new (often sets of distinct, functionally related) protein products, usually involving new mRNA transcripts, typically in response to an activating stimulus.
Considered in comparison with something else; dependent on or interconnected with something else; not absolute.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Lysosomal proteinases or endopeptidases that function optimally at an acidic pH to catalyze the hydrolysis of peptidic bonds. Elevated cathepsin enzyme activity in either serum or extracellular matrix is often indicative of pathological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease, several types of cancer, arthritis, and osteoporosis._The outcome of a laboratory test._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Elevated cathepsin enzyme activity in either serum or extracellular matrix is often indicative of pathological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease, several types of cancer, arthritis, and osteoporosis.:The outcome of a laboratory test.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: Lysosomal proteinases or endopeptidases that function optimally at an acidic pH to catalyze the hydrolysis of peptidic bonds. Elevated cathepsin enzyme activity in either serum or extracellular matrix is often indicative of pathological conditions such as Alzheimer's disease, several types of cancer, arthritis, and osteoporosis.
The outcome of a laboratory test.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
